author: Ross Burden
method: For the potatoes, heat the oil in a pan over a high heat. Add the potatoes and saut√© for five minutes, until browned. Add the wine, cumin seeds and lemon juice and simmer for two minutes. Cover with a lid and allow to cook through for 10-15 minutes. For the asparagus, heat a griddle pan until smoking. Add the asparagus and char-grill for 4-5 minutes, until cooked through. Place the egg yolk and the lemon juice in a bowl and whisk together. Add the melted butter and whisk together well, seasoning, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve, place the potatoes into a serving bowl. Place the asparagus on a plate and drizzle with the hollandaise dressing.
ingredients: 250g/9oz new potatoes, bashed with rolling pin,  1 tbsp olive oil,  splash white wine,  1 tsp cumin seeds,  2 tbsp lemon juice,  1 bunch asparagus, ends trimmed,  1 free-range egg yolk,  2 tsp lemon juice,  25g/1oz butter, melted,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
